intro: Leucophyta platycephala, commonly known as the broad-headed leucophyta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its woody stems and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and often have a bluish-gray hue due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Leucophyta platycephala is adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
